property.name: xcl/artist
property.description: Person who created the digital object.

property.name: xcl/documentTitle
property.description: Title of the document, if different of fileName (possibly only occuring in pdf-files).

property.name: xcl/BackgroundColourRGB
property.description: Hex-Value of a background-colour.

property.name: xcl/lineBreak
property.description: Content-property describing if a string content breaks to a new line

property.name: xcl/caps
property.description: Text-property caps.

property.name: xcl/fontColour
property.description: Font color in text formats.

property.name: xcl/embeddedObjectHeight
property.description: Height of an embedded Object (i.e.: Image, Multimedia-file, table....)

property.name: xcl/bold
property.description: Text-property 'bold'.

property.name: xcl/boldItalic
property.description: Marks text as bold italic.

property.name: xcl/italic
property.description: text-property italic

property.name: xcl/fillColour
property.description: Fill-colour for vector-object.

property.name: xcl/fontName
property.description: Name of font

property.name: xcl/fontChange
property.description: Entry to mark up a change in font-use within an XCDLl-description-file.

property.name: xcl/footnote
property.description: Marks up a certain position in normdata to specify them as a footnote related to other normdata.

property.name: xcl/mergedCellsHorizontal
property.description: Number of cells in a horizontal row that are merged to one cell.

property.name: xcl/hidden
property.description: Text is hidden

property.name: xcl/hypertextLink
property.description: Defines that some textdata contain a hyperlink.

property.name: xcl/imageTextRelation
property.description: Refers to a property-set for an embedded image (id-number).

property.name: xcl/imageData
property.description: Reference to embedded imageData.

property.name: xcl/documentLanguage
property.description: Language of the document.

property.name: xcl/embeddedObject
property.description: Specifies the URL/Path or ID to an embedded object.

property.name: xcl/paragraph
property.description: Describes structured continuous text data.

property.name: xcl/pageBreak
property.description: Property describing if a textual content breaks to a new page (Unit not yet decided)

property.name: xcl/panoseNumber
property.description: A PANOSE classification number consists of 10 concatenated values. Each value from a given category was computed from a specific visual metric, such as the weight of the font and the presence or absence of serifs. [cit. Wikipedia]

property.name: xcl/TrayNumber
property.description: Number of the tray in a selected printer, can be stored in the document.

property.name: xcl/marginTop
property.description: distance between text and margin in a formatted text-document

property.name: xcl/pageNumberStart
property.description: Page-Number for the start of a new document-section

property.name: xcl/customPageSize
property.description: Size of a Text-Page in unit W x H

property.name: xcl/fontWidth_betweenLetters
property.description: Variability of the width of the font: fixed (monospace) variable default.

property.name: xcl/resolutionImage
property.description: Resolution of images. Measured in dpi.

property.name: xcl/marginRight
property.description: distance between text and margin in a formatted text-document

property.name: xcl/smallCaps
property.description: text-property smallCaps

property.name: xcl/strike
property.description: text-property strike

property.name: xcl/fontSize
property.description: Size - normally measured in points - which is applied to a font (rendering information).

property.name: xcl/tableNumberOfColumns
property.description: Number of Columns in a Table

property.name: xcl/tableNumberOfRows
property.description: Number of Rows in a Table

property.name: xcl/textDirection
property.description: Direction of text running in the document, could be right-to-left or left-to-right (also top-down or bottom-up).

property.name: xcl/rgb
property.description: ColourSpace: RGB triple

property.name: xcl/underline
property.description: text-property underline

property.name: xcl/mergedCellsVertical
property.description: "Number of cells in a vertical column that are merged to one cell."

property.name: xcl/bitsPerSampleGreen
property.description: Number of bits per green colour channel

property.name: xcl/bitsPerSampleRed
property.description: Number of bits per red colour channel

property.name: xcl/byteOrder
property.description: Ordering of bytes for multi-byte data values within a file (intel or motorola)

property.name: xcl/imageHeight
property.description: Height of an image in pixel

property.name: xcl/imageWidth
property.description: Width of an image. Corresponds to the x-axis.

property.name: xcl/1931CIE_ChromaticityBlueX
property.description: Value x of pair xy specifying blue colour according to 1931 CIE colour-space.

property.name: xcl/1931CIE_ChromaticityBlueY
property.description: Value y of pair xy specifying green colour according to 1931 CIE colour space.

property.name: xcl/1931CIE_ChromaticityGreenX
property.description: Value x of pair xy specifying green colour according to 1931 CIE colour space.

property.name: xcl/1931CIE_ChromaticityGreenY
property.description: Value y of pair xy specifying green colour according to 1931 CIE colour space.

property.name: xcl/1931CIE_ChromaticityRedX
property.description: Value x of pair xy specifying red colour according to 1931 CIE colour space.

property.name: xcl/1931CIE_ChromaticityRedY
property.description: Value y of pair xy specifying red colour according to 1931 CIE colour space.

property.name: xcl/whitePointX
property.description: Chromaticity of a computer display's nominal white.

property.name: xcl/whitePointY
property.description: Chromaticity of a computer display's nominal white.

property.name: xcl/colourPalette
property.description: A colour map for palette colour images. Usually for RGB coloured pictures. Should be an array of hex-colour-values... depending on bitdepth

property.name: xcl/textualAnnotation
property.description: General textual annotation - not formatted in any kind of metadata-standards like METS.

property.name: xcl/resolutionX
property.description: The number of pixels per ResolutionUnit in the ImageWidth direction.

property.name: xcl/BitDepth
property.description: Number of bits per sample component

property.name: xcl/filter
property.description: Algorithm applied to data.

property.name: xcl/gammaValueRGB
property.description: Level of brightness for pixels ranging from black (0) to white (1). These pixel values serve as the input for the computer monitor. The sRGB and Adobe RGB colour spaces are also based on a gamma of 2.2. Gamma-encoding is supported by certain imagefile formats.

property.name: xcl/ICCProfileName
property.description: Name of the description of the colour space (in the form of an International Colour Consortium (ICC) profile) to which the samples in the image conform, should be something like: sRGB IEC1966-2.1, Adobe RGB Â´98, for cmyk: ISO Coated V2 (ECI) and ISO Uncoated.

property.name: xcl/interlace
property.description: Algorithm for encoding raster image data in multiple layers with the purpose of improved transmission and image build-up.

property.name: xcl/IPTC_Metadata
property.description: Standards of the International Press Telecommunications Council (IPTC) and Newspaper Association of America (NAA) for annotating content of any medial kind.

property.name: xcl/imageOrientation
property.description: Orientation of the image, e.g., landscape or portrait.

property.name: xcl/RLE_Packets
property.description: Number of RLE-Packets (compression property)

property.name: xcl/compressionQuality
property.description: Quality of compression - depending on the used compressionAlgorithm

property.name: xcl/renderingIntent
property.description: The way colour-information is displayed: AbsoluteColourmetric. RelativeColourmetric. Saturation. Perception. Mapped from PNG (where it is an integer) via "same_as" but should be mapped via "int_to_string".

property.name: xcl/resolutionUnit
property.description: Name of the Unit that measures the resolution of theiImage. If it is none: default is generally inch.

property.name: xcl/lineColour
property.description: Colour of a line-/path-object

property.name: xcl/strokeDashArray
property.description: Length of strokes and gaps in a vector-Dash-Line.

property.name: xcl/lineWidth
property.description: Length of a line/path in a vector-object

property.name: xcl/numberOfInks
property.description: numberOfInks (=number of Channels). Should be interesting only if bitDepth/ColourSpace is different than the usual ones...

property.name: xcl/resolutionY
property.description: The number of pixels per ResolutionUnit in the ImageHeigth direction.

property.name: xcl/cmyk
property.description: ColourSpaceName

property.name: xcl/fontEncodingType
property.description: Can be StandardEncoding, MacRomanEncoding, WinAnsiEncoding, and PDF- DocEncoding.

property.name: xcl/deflate_Zlib
property.description: Compression algorithm for textfiles.

property.name: xcl/gammaValueGray
property.description: Level of brightness for pixels ranging from black (0) to white (1). These pixel values serve as the input for the computer monitor. This property is specified for GRAY pictures (no RGB-value array)

property.name: xcl/gray
property.description: 8 Bit ColourInformation (1 Channel) for the whole image

property.name: xcl/Interpolate
property.description: Boolean Value, if an image is interpolated

property.name: xcl/lab-colourspace
property.description: typical LAB colourspace

property.name: xcl/rotationPrint
property.description: The number of degrees by which the page should be rotated clockwise when printed

property.name: xcl/RLE
property.description: CompressionAlgorithm

property.name: xcl/script
property.description: Contains a script. The script-language shall be preserved in the scriptLanguage Property.

property.name: xcl/characterSpacing
property.description: Distance between characters if different than default values.

property.name: xcl/alphaTransparency
property.description: Alpha channel transpareny in value 0-255

property.name: xcl/paletteHistogram
property.description: Approximate usage frequency of each colour in the palette index (rgbPalette).

property.name: xcl/significantBits
property.description: Number of bits that are significant in the samples.

property.name: xcl/suggestedPaletteAlpha
property.description: Alpha value for suggested palette.

property.name: xcl/suggestedPaletteFrequency
property.description: Frequency of suggested palette.

property.name: xcl/suggestedPaletteRGB
property.description: Name of a reduced palette that may be used when the display device is not capable of displaying the full range of colours in the image.

property.name: xcl/suggestedPaletteSampleDepth
property.description: Sample depth of a suggested palette.

property.name: xcl/simpleTransparency
property.description: Simple transparency in opposition to alpha-transparency (and the RGB-value for the colour which is set to be transparent).

property.name: xcl/clipPath
property.description: Clipping Paths attached to image (possible in Tiff and photoshop-files), defined by markers, angles and bÃ©zier-curves.

property.name: xcl/GDALMetadata
property.description: Used by the GDAL library, holds an XML list of name=value pairs

property.name: xcl/thresholding
property.description: For black and white images that represent shades of gray, the technique used to convert from gray to black and white pixels...

property.name: xcl/xmp_Metadata
property.description: XML packet containing XMP metadata. (700) XMP is an extensible way to include metadata such as meaningful descriptions and titles, searchable keywords, and up-to-date author and copyright information

property.name: xcl/cellLengthBilevel
property.description: The height of the dithering or halftoning matrix used to create a dithered or halftoned bilevel file (y-axis)

property.name: xcl/cellHeight
property.description: "The height of the dithering or halftoning matrix used to create a dithered or halftoned bilevel file. "

property.name: xcl/cellWidth
property.description: The width of the dithering or halftoning matrix used to create a dithered or halftoned bilevel file.

property.name: xcl/copyrightNote
property.description: Defines the holder of the copyright.

property.name: xcl/fillOrder
property.description: The logical order of bits within a byte.

property.name: xcl/grayResponseCurve
property.description: For grayscale data, the optical density of each possible pixel value.

property.name: xcl/hostMachineOS
property.description: The computer and/or operating system in use at the time of object creation

property.name: xcl/photoshop
property.description: Collection of Photoshop 'Image Resource Blocks'.

property.name: xcl/planarConfiguration
property.description: How the components of each pixel are stored

property.name: xcl/samplesPerPixel
property.description: The number of components per pixel.

property.name: xcl/analogueDocumentName
property.description: The name of the document before it was digitised.

property.name: xcl/scannerInformation
property.description: Name and other information of the scanner that digitised the image.

property.name: xcl/scannerModel
property.description: Name of the scanner model used to digitise the image.

property.name: xcl/tileByteCounts
property.description: For each tile, the number of (compressed) bytes in that tile.

property.name: xcl/tileLength
property.description: "The tile length (height) in pixels. This is the number of rows in each tile. "

property.name: xcl/tileWidth
property.description: "The tile width in pixels. This is the number of columns in each tile"

metric.name: equal
metric.description: simple comparison of two values (A, B) of any type on equality. Type of output value: Boolean (true, false).

metric.name: hammingDistanceString
metric.description: The hamming distance counts the number of non-corresponding symbols of two ordered sequences. The sequences must have equal length. This version works on arrays of strings.

metric.name: levenshteinDistance
metric.description: The Levenshtein distance (syn. Edit distance) is a distance measure for strings. Two strings are compared with respect to the three basic operations insert, delete and replace in order to transform string A into string B. The value for this metric is the number of operations needed for transformation.

metric.name: simpleMatchCoefficient
metric.description: Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

metric.name: simpleMatchCoefficientN
metric.description: Simple match coefficient is a distance measure that uses the hamming distance. In addition, the ratio of non-corresponding values (hamming distance) to the total number of compared pairs of values is calculated. N indicates the n-grams used for comparison. Default setting is N=1. The result is a rational number from range 0.0 to 1.0, indicating maximum similarity (0.0) to minimum (1.0).

metric.name: RMSE
metric.description: Root mean squared error is a widely used measure for deviation. It is calculated as the square root of the quotient of the summed up squared diffeences of corresponding values of two sets and as denominator the number of values (values in both sets must have the same number).

metric.name: euclidDistance
metric.description: Euclidian distance (syn. L2 distance) is a distance measure; the square root of the sum of the single squred differnces of corresponding values of two sets.

metric.name: hammingDistance
metric.description: The hamming distance counts the number of non-corresponding symbols of two ordered sequences. The sequences must have equal length.

metric.name: intDiff
metric.description: Arithmetical difference of two integer values (A - B)

metric.name: intProd
metric.description: Product of two integer values (A * B).

metric.name: intRatio
metric.description: Quotient of two integer values (A / B).

metric.name: intSum
metric.description: Arithmetical sum of two integer values (A +B).

metric.name: percDeviation
metric.description: Percental deviation of two values (A,B) of type integer or rational, according to the equation: PercDev= d/A*100. A is the source value, d is the difference of values B and A (B-A). The output value indicates the percental deviation of value B from value A. An output value of PercDev=0.0 indicates equal values.

metric.name: standardDeviation
metric.description: Standard deviation is a statistical measure for the distribution of the values of a random variable from the arithmetical mean.

metric.name: ratDiff
metric.description: Arithmetical difference of two rational values (A - B).

metric.name: ratProd
metric.description: Product of two rational values (A * B).

metric.name: ratRatio
metric.description: Quotient of two rational values (A / B).

metric.name: ratSum
metric.description: Arithmetical sum of two rational values (A + B).
